qas.question: At what temperature range in degrees Fahrenheit will uranium metal form uranium hydride?
What does uranium metal react with to create uranium hydride?
Above what temperature is the β form of uranium hydride created?
Along with uranium carbide and halide, what type of compound is often created with uranium hydride?
How many crystal modifications of uranium hydride are extant?
At what temperature range in degrees Fahrenheit won't uranium metal form uranium hydride?
What doesn't uranium metal react with to create uranium hydride?
Above what temperature is the β form of uranium hydride destroyed?
Along with uranium carbide and halide, what type of compound is often destroyed with uranium hydride?
How many crystal modifications of plutonium hydride are extant?

context: Uranium metal heated to 250 to 300 °C (<a0_0><b5_0>482 to 572<a0_0/> °F<b5_0/>) reacts with <a1_0><b6_0>hydrogen<b6_0/><a1_0/> to form uranium hydride. Even higher temperatures will reversibly remove the hydrogen. This property makes uranium hydrides convenient starting materials to create reactive uranium powder along with various uranium carbide, <a3_0><b8_0>nitride<b8_0/><a3_0/>, and halide compounds. <a4_0><b9_0>Two<b9_0/><a4_0/> crystal modifications of uranium hydride exist: an α form that is obtained at low temperatures and a β form that is created when the formation temperature is above <a2_0><b7_0>250 °C<b7_0/><a2_0/>.
